entry.title: lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#504
entry.content:
October 21, 2012
lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#504

If you want to move the cache-ing logic outside the 'controller' then just override the symfony router.
Have a look to $app['url_matcher'], RedirectableUrlMatcher::match

entry.title: lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#504
entry.content:
October 20, 2012
lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#504

I am not sure to understand everythings but : why don't you do that ?

You declare your static routes at the beginning of your controller file.
At the end a wild-card route with the following code : 

$app->get('{slug}', function ($slug) use ($app) {     if (!$app['cache']->has($slug)) {         $record = $app['db']->fetchOne('select * from table where slug = ?', array($slug);         $app['cache']->store($record);     } else {         $record = $app['store']->get($slug);     }     if (!$record) {        throw new 404...();     }     // Main code })->bind('page');  With this code, silex will **not** foreach on 400-500 items

entry.title: lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#504
entry.content:
October 20, 2012
lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#504

All time saves in before is lose in

$sub = Request::create('/seo/{$sec_name}/', 'GET'); return $app->handle($sub, HttpKernelInterface::SUB_REQUEST);

More over, how to you generate links from your template ?

If your routes are static, the router will be very fast.

entry.title: lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#504
entry.content:
October 18, 2012
lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#504

Hello.

If you want to catch all non-existings response, do not use this code : 

$app->get('{url}', function() {     return new Response('Not found!', 404); })->assert('url', '.+');

prefer something like that : 

$app->error(function (\Exception $e, $code) use ($app) {     if ($app['debug']) {         return;     }      switch ($code) {         case 404:             $message = 'The requested page could not be found.';             break;         default:             $message = 'We are sorry, but something went terribly wrong.';     }      return new Response($message, $code); });

and set $app['debug'] = false in prod env to not display exception page. It will save you some CPU cycle.

entry.title: lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#516
entry.content:
October 18, 2012
lyrixx commented on issue fabpot/Silex#516

The local is not use only in translation.
If you want to locale for all your application, declare your locale after the application initialisation.

$app = new Silex\Application(); $app['locale'] = 'fr';

entry.title: lyrixx pushed to create-project-delete-vcs at lyrixx/composer
entry.content:
October 15, 2012
lyrixx pushed to create-project-delete-vcs at lyrixx/composer
  • lyrixx committed 1dd04cb
    Removed useless code
  • lyrixx committed 6f9c342
    Create-project command remove all VCS history

    In fact, there are some issues with create-project command.
    When people create project with composer, they do not think to
    delete main .git folder. So they embed 3th history in theirs own
    repository. (see
    https://connect.sensiolabs.com/profile/jmoati/project/gitoliteadmin
    for instance)

    More over, people may not use git.
  • View comparison for these 2 commits »
